name: Camping De La Pointe St Gilles

reviews.text: We have just returned from a week here at this campsite during a 3 week saty in France. we stayed at 4 campsites overall and I have to say this was outstanding. Spotless Clean.. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Keycamp/Eurocamp staff were amazing and the Kids clubs Macs Funstation for our 7 year old and Base for our 12 year old were just brilliant for them. The children were so happy at this site. The pool complex is fantastic ( indoor pool floor slippy beware).. indoor and outdoor pools were warm and spacious. We had a pitch for our own caravan which is a big twin wheel, and we had no problems with these pitches and they had plenty of space for awning, Jeep ect ... We are going to return next year for 2 weeks to this site. Brilliant facilities as we have a 10month old baby who loved it also.. Baby baths in the nursery and baby facilities were lovely. All round I cannot fault this campsite....Oh and check out the Pain Du Raisins in the shop fresh every morning yummy !!!! 10 / 10
reviews.title: Amazing Campsite !! Spotless clean and staff were brilliant.

reviews.text: We went with Canvas Holidays to this site and met up with our Daughter and family. Our Granddaughter grazed the back of her leg getting out of the pool as it had rough stone edges, quite bad when you consider how many children use it. It was expensive to eat and drink, would recommend going off site. The bike hire not too good, the pedal fell off one of the bikes on the 2nd day! Also a lot of parents just let their children ride anywhere they want regardless of age and although the speed limit is 10 m.p.h. there have been several accidents this year. On the plus side you are only a 5 minute walk from the beach and it is a lovely walk into the centre of Benodet along the sea front.
reviews.title: A good site for families with younger children

reviews.text: Whilst the Brittany weather was varied it did not stop us having a great holiday with our 2 boys aged 3 and 6. The St Gillies site is well maintained and the mobile homes from Matthews holidays offered clean and comfortable accomodation. The onsite reps were very attentive and no request was too much trouble. We arrived late in the evening but we were expected with keys and a very clean van waiting for us! With a fab beach right at the entrance to the site and attractive nearby towns and eateries it really is an easy holiday. We would also recommend the jousting at Ville Close at Concarneau...the boys loved it and mummy too as one of the knights was a double of Colin Firth!
reviews.title: Matthews holidays benodet July 2012

reviews.text: First time with kids abroad in what I feared may be butlins..... Reasonable size mobile homes, in good location, clean and new. Good on site facilities. Lovely beach to the left 10 min walk with gorgeous estuary setting, with fun and safe river flume as the tide went out.
reviews.title: First timer. Pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: First euro camp trip for me,my wife and 9 year old son. Will be returning next year!!. Helped with great weather but even so my son loved the place which allowed us to relax. The whole place felt very safe with the kids clubs providing great entertainment but also a place for my son to meet the other kids on the park. Location great with a fab little train ride into the town which can also be walked to along the beach. The camp site backs onto a lovely little beach although the sea is very cold. A couple of points to note. I agree, a little, with a previous reviewer about the pool surround surface a it is a little bit abrasive and care needs to be taken. Also be aware of the daily scramble for getting towels on those all too precious sunbeds. All in all a fab holiday which we will repeat
reviews.title: First euro camp trip

reviews.text: Stayed in a Eurocamp Safari Tent:
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings..

reviews.text: Eurocamp are great, this is our 2nd Eurocamp holiday and our 2nd time in the safari tent. The Eurocamp staff on site are helpful and a great hit with the kids. The safari tent was once again very comfortable and well stocked although on this site really REALLY close to neighbours. Car parking is a problem when every tent on the row was full.
reviews.title: Fab Family Holiday!

reviews.text: Now the site: Just didn't like it. Not to my taste at all. We could have been at Butlins in Bognor Regis. Everyone we met was English (that's no bad thing..we are too) but it seemed like the site catered for the lowest common denominator. Dreadful English food in the restaurant (if you could find it open). Drab bar with no atmosphere. Supermarket with french opening times (beware on the day you arrive - bring snacks with you as everything is closed if you arrive between 2 and 4.30). Lack of fresh bread, fresh fruit and vegetables and very limited stock in the supermarket. Good wine though, reasonably priced. The site is really crammed too; not much atmosphere with tents and mobile homes in long rows, a litte too close together. 2 sets of toilets and showers but one permanently locked meant queues as the site was pretty busy. What on earth is with the no toilet seats. I had to clean every toilet we sat on.. bleurgh.
reviews.title: lovely family break

reviews.text: The pool looks great, and in theory is great but... no indication that the water is heated, it was freezing outside and only just warm enough inside. The inside pools are (frankly) dangerous and I am not an overprotective health and safety zealot. I saw lots of people, kids and adults slip on the poolside and 2 of our 4 kids had nasty bangs on the head. Pointe St. Gilles people you need to spend some money improving the pool in the closed season. It's not good!
reviews.title: A very clean and pleasant place for a family holiday.

reviews.text: Spa is good enough, nice 2 hour pool, sauna and steam room package for 25 Euro, but no showers??? You have to use the site showers. Missed a touch there I think.
reviews.title: Very good and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week here 8th - 15th Sept 2012 in a mobile home.
reviews.title: Site is fine but very quiet in evenings

reviews.text: First thoughts on staying at this time of year is that its all closing down as its the end of the summer season, the shop had the basics, plus a few things you will need, a pan scourer, washing up liquid, bin bags to name a few. Oh and beer and wine so the esentials were covered.
reviews.title: Benodet....

reviews.text: Site was clean and tidy, so was the mobile home, but if you were staying on site every day I think it would drive you mad as there isnt much to do.
reviews.title: Site okay but venture out to make the most of this holiday.

reviews.text: We decided to explore local towns and points of interest so I cant comment on the pool as we didnt go. The bar is massive but its soulless, basically a big room with a stage and a bar at one end we went once and that was enough for us.
reviews.title: Not 5 stars!

reviews.text: Its a good base for your holiday if your touring, a massive drive from Calais, so I would consider using a closer crossing next time, but it came in our deal so no choice. Both the Saturdays were used up in travelling to and from the port and the biggest cost of the whole holiday was petrol.
reviews.title: Wonderful family holiday

reviews.text: Not the best campsite I've stayed on in France but definitely not the worst. We took our grandchildren (12 & 10) and they absolutely loved it. So much so, apart from the odd safety checks from us, we hardly saw them from noon until 7pm. This site is very much geared towards families, well run, safe and in a great location. The shop on site is a little expensive but Carrefour is only a short drive away. What really impressed was the attitude of the staff, can't praise them enough.
reviews.title: Kids didn't want to leave

reviews.text: Went with Matthews holidays in middle priced caravan. Site is great for kids of all ages, swimming pool complex has indoors and out, looked a bit strange because the floor of the pools were not blue, but grey ish but otherwise it was great. People actually enter the pool before it opens to baggsy a sun lounger with their towel and then don't sit on it, which was annoying and shouldn't be allowed. There was evening entertainment in the bar which seemed busy, a cafe and take away which looked ok but were not cheap. The enterance to the site is really chaotic which cars, padestrians and a mini train all josstling for space. I imagine there are accidents weekly, it's scary. The site is directly onto a beach and about a 5 min walk round the bay to a really lovely beach on benodet with fantastic ice cream shops very close. The Matthews holidays reps were a very lovely couple and the caravan was spotless, it had everything you would need and was a good size. The pitch was small and we were close to our neighbours, we were opposite people who used Euro camp in a tent and they had even less space (and prob paid a lot more than us!) we had to buy our own BBQ from the supermarket but it was only 15 euro so was no problem. We would def return with Matthews again in this size caravan and by booking very early got a fantastic deal. This site had lots of English people with a tiny few Dutch, Irish and German families. I def wouldn't go there without kids!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: We have just returned from our holiday at Camping De La Pointe St Gilles with our 2 children (aged 7 & almost 2) which was really good and thoroughly enjoyed by all.
reviews.title: Brilliant Location, Great for the Kids
Kids enjoyed it, we weren't so sure!
reviews.text: The site is in a great location, with a 20-30 minute walk in to Benodet and the entrance is approx 30 meters from a small sandy beach with rocks either side which are ideal for rock pooling at low tide. The beach only seems to be used by the site residents and even during the afternoon on the sunniest day of the week it wasn't overly crowded. we also we very close to the pool and entertainment facility's, we didn't have much interaction with the reps which didn't concern me too much as its not Club 18-30 and im an adult who can organise my own life

We took some advice from an earlier post on here which mentioned cutting out the middle man (key/euro camp) and booking direct with sunelia. Not only was it much cheaper (a chalet/caravan with sunelia was the same price as a tent with other travel agency's) but their accommodation wasn't as crammed in as the others. As we booked with a French agency, we got French accommodation, so no kettle for tea but a coffee percolator, oyster knife and lobster cracker! we like to "go native" when on holiday so none of this was a problem for us.
reviews.title: No Complaints

aka: Camping De La Pointe St Gilles Hotel
